qas.question: How many courts are there on Tuvalu?
What is the name of the superior court of Tuvalu?
What is the High Court's right to determine?
What judge is the Chief Justice of the Tuvalu High Court?
To where can judgments be appealed?

context: There are <a0_0>eight<a0_0/> Island Courts and Lands Courts; appeals in relation to land disputes are made to the Lands Courts Appeal Panel. Appeals from the Island Courts and the Lands Courts Appeal Panel are made to the Magistrates Court, which has jurisdiction to hear civil cases involving up to $T10,000. The superior court is the <a1_0>High Court of Tuvalu<a1_0/> as it has unlimited original jurisdiction to determine the <a2_0>Law of Tuvalu<a2_0/> and to hear appeals from the lower courts. <a3_0>Sir Gordon Ward<a3_0/> is the current Chief Justice of Tuvalu. Rulings of the High Court can be appealed to the <a4_0>Court of Appeal of Tuvalu<a4_0/>. From the Court of Appeal there is a right of appeal to Her Majesty in Council, i.e., the Privy Council in London.
